verses.verse: I made <S%H3772><s%> a covenant <S%H1285><s%> with mine eyes <S%H5869><s%>; How then should I look <S%H995><s%> upon a virgin <S%H1330><s%>?
For what is the portion <S%H2506><s%> from God <S%H433><s%> above <S%H4605><s%>, And the heritage <S%H5159><s%> from the Almighty <S%H7706><s%> on high <S%H4791><s%>?
Is it not calamity <S%H343><s%> to the unrighteous <S%H5767><s%>, And disaster <S%H5235><s%> to the workers <S%H6466><s%> of iniquity <S%H205><s%>?
Doth not he see <S%H7200><s%> my ways <S%H1870><s%>, And number <S%H5608><s%> all my steps <S%H6806><s%>?
If I have walked <S%H1980><s%> with falsehood <S%H7723><s%>, And my foot <S%H7272><s%> hath hasted <S%H2363><s%> to deceit <S%H4820><s%>
(Let me be weighed <S%H8254><s%> in an even <S%H6664><s%> balance <S%H3976><s%>, That God <S%H433><s%> may know <S%H3045><s%> mine integrity <S%H8538><s%>);

If my step <S%H838><s%> hath turned out <S%H5186><s%> of the way <S%H1870><s%>, And my heart <S%H3820><s%> walked <S%H1980><s%> after <S%H310><s%> mine eyes <S%H5869><s%>, And if any spot <S%H3971><s%> hath cleaved <S%H1692><s%> to my hands <S%H3709><s%>:
Then let me sow <S%H2232><s%>, and let another <S%H312><s%> eat <S%H398><s%>; Yea <S%H6631><s%>, let the produce of my field be rooted out <S%H8327><s%>.
If my heart <S%H3820><s%> hath been enticed <S%H6601><s%> unto a woman <S%H802><s%>, And I have laid wait <S%H693><s%> at my neighbor <S%H7453><s%>'s door <S%H6607><s%>;
Then let my wife <S%H802><s%> grind <S%H2912><s%> unto another <S%H312><s%>, And let others <S%H312><s%> bow down upon her <S%H3766><s%>.
For that were a heinous crime <S%H2154><s%>; Yea <S%H5771><s%>, it were an iniquity to be punished by the judges <S%H6414><s%>:
For it is a fire <S%H784><s%> that consumeth <S%H398><s%> unto Destruction <S%H11><s%>, And would root out <S%H8327><s%> all mine increase <S%H8393><s%>.
If I have despised <S%H3988><s%> the cause <S%H4941><s%> of my man-servant <S%H5650><s%> or of my maid-servant <S%H519><s%>, When they contended with me <S%H7379><s%>;
What then shall I do <S%H6213><s%> when God <S%H410><s%> riseth up <S%H6965><s%>? And when he visiteth <S%H6485><s%>, what shall I answer him <S%H7725><s%>?
Did not he that made <S%H6213><s%> me in the womb <S%H990><s%> make <S%H6213><s%> him <S%H259><s%>? And did not one fashion <S%H3559><s%> us in the womb <S%H7358><s%>?
If I have withheld <S%H4513><s%> the poor <S%H1800><s%> from their desire <S%H2656><s%>, Or have caused the eyes <S%H5869><s%> of the widow <S%H490><s%> to fail <S%H3615><s%>,
Or have eaten <S%H398><s%> my morsel <S%H6595><s%> alone <S%H3490><s%>, And the fatherless hath not eaten thereof <S%H398><s%>
(Nay <S%H5271><s%>, from my youth he grew up <S%H1431><s%> with me as with a father <S%H1><s%>, And her have I guided <S%H5148><s%> from my mother <S%H517><s%>'s womb <S%H990><s%>);
If I have seen <S%H7200><s%> any perish <S%H6><s%> for want of clothing <S%H3830><s%>, Or that the needy <S%H34><s%> had no covering <S%H3682><s%>;
If his loins <S%H2504><s%> have not blessed <S%H1288><s%> me <S%H2552><s%>, And if he hath not been warmed with the fleece <S%H1488><s%> of my sheep <S%H3532><s%>;
If I have lifted up <S%H5130><s%> my hand <S%H3027><s%> against the fatherless <S%H3490><s%>, Because I saw <S%H7200><s%> my help <S%H5833><s%> in the gate <S%H8179><s%>:
Then let my shoulder fall <S%H5307><s%> from the shoulder-blade <S%H7929><s%>, And mine arm <S%H248><s%> be broken <S%H7665><s%> from the bone <S%H7070><s%>.
For calamity <S%H343><s%> from God <S%H410><s%> is a terror <S%H6343><s%> to me <S%H7613><s%>, And by reason of his majesty I can do nothing <S%H3201><s%>.
If I have made <S%H7760><s%> gold <S%H2091><s%> my hope <S%H3689><s%>, And have said <S%H559><s%> to the fine gold <S%H3800><s%>, Thou art my confidence <S%H4009><s%>;
If I have rejoiced <S%H8055><s%> because my wealth <S%H2428><s%> was great <S%H7227><s%>, And because my hand <S%H3027><s%> had gotten <S%H4672><s%> much <S%H3524><s%>;
If I have beheld <S%H7200><s%> the sun <S%H216><s%> when it shined <S%H1984><s%>, Or the moon <S%H3394><s%> walking <S%H1980><s%> in brightness <S%H3368><s%>,
And my heart <S%H3820><s%> hath been secretly <S%H5643><s%> enticed <S%H6601><s%>, And my mouth <S%H6310><s%> hath kissed <S%H5401><s%> my hand <S%H3027><s%>:
This also were an iniquity <S%H5771><s%> to be punished by the judges <S%H6416><s%>; For I should have denied <S%H3584><s%> the God <S%H410><s%> that is above <S%H4605><s%>.
If I have rejoiced <S%H8055><s%> at the destruction <S%H6365><s%> of him that hated <S%H8130><s%> me <S%H5782><s%>, Or lifted up myself when evil <S%H7451><s%> found him <S%H4672><s%>;
(Yea <S%H5414><s%>, I have not suffered my mouth <S%H2441><s%> to sin <S%H2398><s%> By asking <S%H7592><s%> his life <S%H5315><s%> with a curse <S%H423><s%>);
If the men <S%H4962><s%> of my tent <S%H168><s%> have not said <S%H559><s%>, Who can find <S%H5414><s%> one that hath not been filled <S%H7646><s%> with his meat <S%H1320><s%>?
(The sojourner <S%H1616><s%> hath not lodged <S%H3885><s%> in the street <S%H2351><s%>; But I have opened <S%H6605><s%> my doors <S%H1817><s%> to the traveller <S%H734><s%>);
If like Adam <S%H121><s%> I have covered <S%H3680><s%> my transgressions <S%H6588><s%>, By hiding <S%H2934><s%> mine iniquity <S%H5771><s%> in my bosom <S%H2243><s%>,

Because I feared <S%H6206><s%> the great <S%H7227><s%> multitude <S%H1995><s%>, And the contempt <S%H937><s%> of families <S%H4940><s%> terrified <S%H2865><s%> me <S%H1826><s%>, So that I kept silence, and went not out <S%H3318><s%> of the door <S%H6607><s%>â€”

Oh that <S%H5414><s%> I had one to hear <S%H8085><s%> me <S%H8420><s%>! (Lo, here is my signature, let the Almighty <S%H7706><s%> answer <S%H6030><s%> me <S%H5612><s%>); And that I had the indictment which mine adversary <S%H376><s%> hath written <S%H3789><s%>!
Surely I would carry <S%H5375><s%> it upon my shoulder <S%H7926><s%>; I would bind <S%H6029><s%> it unto me as a crown <S%H5850><s%>:
I would declare <S%H5046><s%> unto him the number <S%H4557><s%> of my steps <S%H6806><s%>; As a prince <S%H5057><s%> would I go near unto him <S%H7126><s%>.
If my land <S%H127><s%> crieth <S%H2199><s%> out against me <S%H3162><s%>, And the furrows <S%H8525><s%> thereof weep together <S%H1058><s%>;
If I have eaten <S%H398><s%> the fruits <S%H3581><s%> thereof without money <S%H3701><s%>, Or have caused the owners <S%H1167><s%> thereof to lose <S%H5301><s%> their life <S%H5315><s%>:

Let thistles <S%H2336><s%> grow <S%H3318><s%> instead of wheat <S%H2406><s%>, And cockle <S%H890><s%> instead of barley <S%H8184><s%>. The words <S%H1697><s%> of Job <S%H347><s%> are ended <S%H8552><s%>.
